intro: Angraecum nutans, commonly known as the star orchid, is a climbing epiphytic orchid native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its long, trailing stems and clusters of fragrant, star-shaped flowers that open at night. The plant produces nectar-rich flowers with long, tubular spurs, adapted for pollination by moths. Its leaves are alternate,革质 (leathery), and often have a waxy coating. Angraecum nutans is known for its striking appearance and is a popular species among orchid enthusiasts.
